headline.main: Birth Control Pills: A Balance Sheet on Their National Impact; Birth Control Pills: A Balance Sheet of Their Impact on Women and Research

docs.abstract: NY Times survey on impact of oral contraceptives in US; notes many women have stopped taking pills; discusses side effects and development of new type of pill; graph of number of users, '61-69; illus
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. David G., a lithe 35-year-old brunette, began taking oral contraceptives after the birth of her third child. But now, two years later, she has given up the pill because, she says, "I became so irritable and depressed that my family couldn't live with me."
